children.name: fileroot
children.label:
the name of your current project
this will be used as name for the generated structures

children.name: run_dir
children.label:
RUN directory
the absolute path of your current run, e.g. /home/haddock/run1

children.name: temptrash_dir
children.label:
Logfile directory
specify a directory for the large CNS log files

children.name: haddock_dir
children.label:
HADDOCK directory
the absolute path of the HADDOCK program files

children.name: ncomponents
children.label: number of components

children.name: prot_coor_NN
children.label: PDB file of molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_psf_NN
children.label: PSF file of molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_segid_NN
children.label: segid of molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_root_NN
children.label: fileroot of molecule (protein) A

children.name: moltype_NN
children.label: Molecular Type

children.name: cg_NN
children.label: Coarse grained molecule?

children.name: prot_cg_top_NN
children.label: coarse-grained topology file for molecule NN

children.name: prot_cg_link_NN
children.label: coarse-grained linkage file for molecule NN

children.name: prot_cg_par_NN
children.label: coarse-grained energy parameter file for molecule NN

children.name: delenph_NN
children.label: Remove non-polar hydrogens?
histidine patches

children.name: NN_hisd_resid_AA
children.label: HISD for Molecule NN (removes HD1)

children.name: NN_hise_resid_AA
children.label: HISE for Molecule NN (removes HE1)
Definition of semi-flexible interface

children.text:
Define the interface of each molecule.
Side-chains and backbone of these residues will be allowed to move during semi-flexible refinement
number of semi-flexible segments for molecule (protein) A (-1 for automated mode)
Note that current max is 10 (edit the run.cns to add more segments

children.label: Segment definition

children.name: NN_start_seg_AA
children.label: First residue of semi-flexbile segment AA of molecule (protein) NN

children.name: NN_end_seg_AA
children.label: Last residue of semi-flexbile segment AA of molecule (protein) NN
Definition of fully flexible segments

children.text:
Define the fully flexible segment of each molecule.
These segments will be allowed to move at all stages of it1

children.name: nfle_NN
children.label:
Number of fully flexible segments for molecule (protein) NN
Note that current max is 5 (edit the run.cns to add more segments
Segment definition

children.name: NN_start_fle_AA
children.label: First residue of fully flexbile segment AA of molecule (protein) NN

children.name: NN_end_fle_AA
children.label: Last residue of fully flexbile segment AA of molecule (protein) NN

children.name: zres_on
children.label: Do you want to use membrane positioning restraints ?

children.name: kzres
children.label: Force constant for membrane positioning restraints ?

children.name: zresmax
children.label: Maximum z value for membrane positioning restraints ?

children.name: zresmin
children.label: Minimum z value for membrane positioning restraints ?

children.name: numzres
children.label: Number of membrane positioning restrained segments
Segment definition

children.name: zres_sta_NN
children.label: First residue number of segment

children.name: zres_end_NN
children.label: Last residue number of segment

children.name: zres_seg_NN
children.label: SEGID(chainID) of segment

children.name: zres_type_NN
children.label: Restraint inside or outside the membrane

children.name: ncs_on
children.label: Do you want to use NCS restraints?

children.name: kncs
children.label: Force constant for NCS restraints

children.name: numncs
children.label: Number of NCS pairs
NCS pair

children.text: Define the segments pairs for NCS restraints

children.name: ncs_sta1_AA
children.label: First residue number of component 1

children.name: ncs_end1_AA
children.label: Last residue number of component 1

children.name: ncs_seg1_AA
children.label: SEGID(chainID) of component 1

children.name: ncs_sta2_AA
children.label: First residue number of component 2

children.name: ncs_end2_AA
children.label: Last residue number of component 2

children.name: ncs_seg2_AA
children.label: SEGID(chainID) of component 2

children.name: sym_on
children.label: Do you want to use symmetry restraints ?

children.name: ksym
children.label: Force constant for symmetry restraints ?

children.name: numc2sym
children.label: Number of C2 symmetry pairs

children.name: c2sym_staAA_NN
children.label: Define the segment pairs C2 symmetry restraints

children.name: numc3sym
children.label: Number of C3 symmetry triples

children.name: c3sym_staAA_NN
children.label: Define the segment triples for C3 symmetry restraints

children.name: nums3sym
children.label: Number of S3 symmetry triples

children.name: s3sym_staAA_NN
children.label: Define the segment triples for S3 symmetry restraints

children.name: numc4sym
children.label: Number of C4 symmetry quadruples

children.name: c4sym_staAA_NN
children.label: Define the segment quadruples for C4 symmetry restraints

children.name: numc5sym
children.label: Number of C5 symmetry

children.name: c5sym_staAA_NN
children.label: Define the segments for C5 symmetry restraints

children.text: Turn on/off and energy constants for distance restraints

children.name: noecv
children.label: Do you want to randomly exclude a fraction of the ambiguous restraints (AIRs)?

children.name: ncvpart
children.label: Number of partitions for random exclusion (%excluded=100/number of partitions)?

children.name: hbonds_on
children.label: Do you want to use hydrogen bond restraints?

children.name: ranair
children.label:
Do you want to define randomly ambiguous interaction restraints from accessible residues?
Only residues in the defined flexible segments will be considered
Note that this option is exclusive with any other distance restraints and only for it0

children.name: cmrest
children.label:
Do you want to define center of mass restraints to enforce contact between the molecules?
Note that these are only active during it0 and it1

children.name: kcont
children.label: Force constant for center of mass restraints

children.name: surfrest
children.label:
Do you want to define surface contact restraints to enforce contact between the molecules?
Note that these are only active during it0 and it1

children.name: ksurf
children.label: Force constant for surface contact restraints

children.name: rgrest
children.label: Do you want to define a radius of gyration restraint (e.g. from SAXS)?

children.name: rgtarg
children.label: Radius of gyration

children.name: krg_hot
children.label: Force constant for radius of gyration restraint

children.name: rgsele
children.label: Atom selections for the radius of gyration restraint

children.name: dnarest_on
children.label: Use DNA/RNA restraints (dna-rna_restraints.def in data/sequence)?

children.name: ssdihed
children.label: Automatically define backbone dihedral angle restraints from structure?

children.text:
Karplus coefficients: edit manually the run.cns file to specify them if needed
The jcoupling restraint files should be present in the data/jcouplings directory
and named c1.tbl, c2.tbl, ...

children.name: prot_top_NN
children.label: topology file for molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_link_NN
children.label: linkage file for molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_par_NN
children.label: energy parameter file for molecule (protein) A

children.name: par_nonbonded
children.label:
type of non-bonded parameters
specify the type of non-bonded interaction

label: coarse graining topology and parameter files

children.name: prot_cg_top_NN
children.label: topology file for molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_cg_link_NN
children.label: linkage file for molecule (protein) A

children.name: prot_cg_par_NN
children.label: energy parameter file for molecule (protein) A

children.text:
Do you want to include the electrostatic energy term for docking?
Note that it will be automatically included in the solvent refinement

children.name: elecflag_0
children.label: Include electrostatic during rigid body docking (it0)?

children.name: elecflag_1
children.label: Include electrostatic during semi-flexible SA (it1)?

children.name: epsilon
children.label:
Give the epsilon constant for the electrostatic energy term?
Note that for explicit solvent refinement cdie with epsilon=1 is used

children.name: dielec
children.label: Use constant (cdie) or distance-dependent (rdie) dielectric?

children.name: inter_rigid
children.label: Scaling of intermolecular interactions for rigid body EM

children.text: Setting for the rigid-body (it0) and semi-flexible refiment (it1)

children.name: structures_0
children.label: number of structures for rigid body docking

children.name: structures_1
children.label: number of structures for refinement

children.name: anastruc_1
children.label: number of structures to be analysed

children.name: rotate180_0
children.label: Sample 180 degrees rotated solutions during rigid body EM?

children.name: rotate180_1
children.label: Sample 180 degrees rotated solutions during semi-flexible SA?

children.name: crossdock
children.label:
Cross-dock all combinations in the ensembles of starting structures?
Turn off this option if you only want to dock structure 1 of ensemble A
to structure 1 of ensemble B, structure 2 to structure 2, etc.

children.name: randorien
children.label: Randomize starting orientations?

children.name: rigidmini
children.label: Perform initial rigid body minimisation?

children.name: rigidtrans
children.label: Allow translation in rigid body minimisation?

children.name: ntrials
children.label: Number of trials for rigid body minimisation?

children.name: iniseed
children.label:
initial seed for random number generator
change to get different initial velocities

children.name: tadhigh_t
children.label: temperature for rigid body high temperature TAD

children.name: tadinit1_t
children.label: initial temperature for rigid body first TAD cooling step

children.name: tadfinal1_t
children.label: final temperature after first cooling step

children.name: tadinit2_t
children.label: initial temperature for second TAD cooling step with flexible side-chain at the inferface

children.name: tadfinal2_t
children.label: finale temperature after second cooling step

children.name: tadinit3_t
children.label: initial temperature for third TAD cooling step with fully flexible interface

children.name: tadfinal3_t
children.label: finale temperature after third cooling step

children.name: timestep
children.label: time step

children.name: tadfactor
children.label: factor for timestep in TAD

children.name: initiosteps
children.label: number of MD steps for rigid body high temperature TAD

children.name: cool1_steps
children.label: number of MD steps during first rigid body cooling stage

children.name: cool2_steps
children.label: number of MD steps during second cooling stage with flexible side-chains at interface

children.name: cool3_steps
children.label: number of MD steps during third cooling stage with fully flexible interface

children.name: waterdock
children.label: perform solvated docking ?

children.name: db_method
children.label:
which propensity database to use?
statistical: based on an analysis of water-mediated contacts in the PDB, kyte-doolittle: based on the Kyte-Doolittle hydrophobicity scalte

children.name: water_restraint_scale
children.label: force constant for restrainted solvating method

children.name: water_randfrac
children.label: random fraction to be added to the fraction of water to keep

children.name: water_surfcutoff
children.label:
water-protein surface-cutoff
waters further away than this cutoff distance from any component of the complex will be removed

children.name: water_analysis
children.label: do some water analysis

children.name: transwater
children.label: allows translation of water molecules during rigid-body docking, true or false:

children.name: waterensemble
children.label: number of different initial solvation shells to generate

children.name: firstwater
children.label: Do you want to refine your docking models in explicit solvent?

children.name: solvshell
children.label:
Build explicit solvent shell? (Can be turned off the large molecules or when morphing CG to AA models)
Only EM will then be performed

children.name: solvent
children.label: Which solvent do you want to use?

children.name: waterrefine
children.label:
number of structures for the explicit solvent refinement
the n best structures will be refined

children.name: waterheatsteps
children.label: number of steps for heating phase (100, 200, 300K)?

children.name: watersteps
children.label: number of steps for 300K sampling phase?

children.name: watercoolsteps
children.label: number of steps for cooling phase (300, 200, 100K)?

children.name: keepwater
children.label: write additional PDB files including solvent ?

children.text: Settings for the scoring of the docking solutions

children.name: smoothing
children.label: Perform smoothed-scoring selection for rigid-body docking solutions ?

children.name: skip_struc
children.label:
It is possible to skip structures in the selection of structure in it0
Give for this the number of structures to skip:

children.name: dist_hb
children.label: Cutoff distance (proton-acceptor) to define an hydrogen bond?

children.name: dist_nb
children.label: Cutoff distance (carbon-carbon) to define an hydrophobic contact?

children.name: clust_meth
children.label: Clustering method (RMSD or Fraction of Common Contacts (FCC))

children.name: clust_cutoff
children.label: RMSD cutoff for clustering? (Recommended values: RMSD 7.5, FCC 0.75)

children.name: clust_size
children.label: Minimum cluster size?

children.name: fcc_ignc
children.label: Chain-Agnostic Algorithm (used for FCC clustering in symmetrical complexes)

children.name: cleanup
children.label: Clean up the run directory after completion (only files for struct #1 are kept) ?
